answerText: "The Hollow Men"[10] This other poem by the same author asks "After such knowledge, what forgiveness?" and is narrated by a man living in a "decayed" and "draughty" house who describes himself as "a dull head among windy spaces."
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 8 | 14 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  14. The title figures of this poem have "shape without form, shade without colour." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem, whose speaker mentions "eyes I dare not meet in dreams" in the beginning of its second section. It ends by claiming "This is the way the world ends / Not with a bang but with a whimper."
